question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Deserialization attack] Can an attacker craft malicious BCS-encoded bytes with excessively large String fields (old_uri or new_uri) to cause memory exhaustion during deserialization, leading to validator node crashes and consensus disruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Type confusion] Can malicious bytes be crafted to deserialize into a CollectionUriMutate with mismatched type tags, bypassing type safety checks and causing state corruption when processed by indexers or event translators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Integer overflow] During BCS deserialization of String length prefixes for collection_name, old_uri, or new_uri fields, can integer overflow in length calculations cause buffer overflows or memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Recursive deserialization] Can nested or recursive BCS structures be crafted to trigger stack overflow during deserialization, causing validator crashes and loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Partial deserialization] If BCS deserialization fails partway through (e.g., after creator_addr but before new_uri), could partially constructed CollectionUriMutate objects leak memory or cause undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [String injection] Can collection_name field contain malicious control characters, null bytes, or SQL injection payloads that compromise indexer databases or API query systems? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [URI validation bypass] Are old_uri and new_uri fields validated for proper URI format, or can attackers inject javascript: or data: URIs to execute malicious code when rendered by clients/explorers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Unicode normalization] Can Unicode homograph attacks in collection_name allow attackers to create visually identical but cryptographically distinct collection names, enabling phishing or name squatting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [String length DoS] Can unbounded String lengths in collection_name, old_uri, or new_uri fields exceed gas limits during event emission or processing, causing transaction failures or validator slowdowns? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Path traversal] Can old_uri or new_uri contain path traversal sequences (../) that compromise file systems when processed by off-chain indexers or IPFS gateways? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: creator_addr()] [Address spoofing] Can creator_addr be set to system addresses (0x1, 0x3, 0x4) to falsely attribute collection URI mutations to core framework modules, enabling social engineering attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: creator_addr()] [Zero address bypass] Does creator_addr accept the zero address (0x0), potentially allowing invalid or system-level events that break indexer assumptions about valid creator accounts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Address collision] If AccountAddress hash collisions are possible, can attackers generate colliding addresses to impersonate legitimate collection creators and mutate URIs maliciously? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Event replay] Can CollectionUriMutate events be replayed across different transactions or blocks to create duplicate URI mutation records in indexers, causing state confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Event ordering violation] If multiple CollectionUriMutate events are emitted for the same collection in a single transaction, is ordering guaranteed, or can race conditions cause old_uri/new_uri mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Cross-transaction consistency] Can URI mutations in different transactions create inconsistent event chains where new_uri of event N doesn't match old_uri of event N+1? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [URI mismatch] Can old_uri and new_uri be identical, creating no-op mutation events that waste storage and confuse indexers about actual state changes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [Collection existence] Does event emission validate that the collection actually exists on-chain, or can phantom URI mutation events be created for non-existent collections? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Function: new()] [State validation bypass] Can new() constructor be called directly to create CollectionUriMutate events without going through proper Move validation logic, bypassing access control checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Impl: MoveStructType] [Module name mismatch] If MODULE_NAME 'token_event_store' doesn't match the actual Move module emitting events, can type confusion attacks occur during event processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Impl: MoveStructType] [Struct name collision] Can STRUCT_NAME 'CollectionUriMutate' collide with other event types in different modules, causing event routing errors or state corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Impl: MoveEventV2Type] [Event version mismatch] Does MoveEventV2Type implementation ensure backward compatibility with V1 events, or can version mismatches cause event translation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Static: COLLECTION_URI_MUTATE_TYPE] [Type tag manipulation] Can the static TypeTag be modified or replaced at runtime to redirect event processing to malicious handlers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Static: COLLECTION_URI_MUTATE_TYPE] [Address spoofing in TypeTag] Does TOKEN_ADDRESS (0x3) validation ensure events come from legitimate token module, or can attackers forge events with same type structure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/collection_uri_mutate.rs] [Struct: CollectionUriMutate] [String allocation DoS] Can extremely large String allocations in collection_name, old_uri, or new_uri cause heap exhaustion when multiple events are processed concurrently? (Medium)
